enjug.erijan.games.yatzy.control

Class SelectiveScoreSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • enjug.erijan.games.yatzy.control.SelectiveScoreSelection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScoringBehavior

    public class SelectiveScoreSelection
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScoringBehavior
    The most common variant of score selection gives full flexibility on where to put a dice result. Setting a 0 result is the same as crossing a score box. Interacts with all three parts of the model: score sheet, state and dice.

    Created by Jan Eriksson on 16/11/15.

    • Method Detail

      • setScore

        public void setScore(java.lang.String boxId)
        Called when player selects a score. Sets score on specified box, clears temporary scores, blocks scoring, unblocks rolling, evaluates if game ends and advances game to next player.
        Specified by:
        setScore in interface ScoringBehavior
        Parameters:
        boxId - Id of score to set.

      • setTempScores

        public void setTempScores()
        Usually called after dice roll to show the different score results of a dice roll.
        Specified by:
        setTempScores in interface ScoringBehavior

      • evaluateGameEnd

        public void evaluateGameEnd()
        Checks if the game is ended. Game ends when all scores are set for all players. If game ends, no rolling or scoring is allowed. Winner i set on the model. GUI will handle visual notification of winner.
        Specified by:
        evaluateGameEnd in interface ScoringBehavior
